main event: A large, orange and red, round object larger than a basketball was observed hovering and moving slowly in Franklin, Wisconsin on 26 June 1954.
interesting points: The object flickered and cast a light trail or exhaust., It was observed at a 45-degree angle moving in the west-southwest direction., The sighting lasted for 45 minutes., The object made no sound during the observation., It was concluded that the object could not be identified, with possibilities including a weather balloon or aircraft.
sighted object: large, round object larger than a basketball, orange and red in color
witness description: James J Knauss observed the object with ground visual observation, no optical aids.
